result.execSummary:
The defendant Randall L Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Randall L Johnson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Randall L Johnson was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Randall L Johnson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant appeared, pro-se.  Margaret Delain appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim C.R. in court. Hearing her defn's request to remove no contact w/C.R. C.R. indicates that she wants no contact condition of probation dropped. Ct. orders JOC amended from no contact with C.R. to defendant shall commit no acts or threats of violence towards C.R. All other previously ordered conditions to remain the same.  Amended Judgment of Conviction prepared.
Hearing on April 20, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
